node.title: 'Move on, frankly': PM says he has no intention of apologising to French President over sub decision
node.alt: Morrison speaks to the press in front of a ship in Glasgow.
node.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says he will not apologise to France after President Emmanuel Macron accused the PM of lies and deceit over a cancelled submarine deal.
node.content: ["Prime Minister Scott Morrison says he will not\u00a0apologise to France for his decision to scrap a $90 billion contract for France to supply 12 conventionally powered submarines for Australia.", "Mr Morrison was called a liar by French President Emmanuel Macron for allegedly hiding Australia's intention to terminate the French contract in favour of a nuclear submarine deal with, jointly, the UK\u00a0and US.", "Following Mr Macron's accusation, the government leaked text messages of Mr Morrison's exchange with the French President the evening before the deal was announced.", "Returning from an international climate summit where the pair endured an awkward exchange, Mr Morrison said there was\u00a0\"no need\" for him to apologise to the French President.", "\"Claims were made and claims were refuted,\" Mr Morrison said.", "\"It's important now we just\u00a0move on, frankly.", "\"What's needed now is for us to just get on with it.", "Mr Morrison said Australia's deal with the French no longer suited the country's defence needs\u00a0and, so, the government exercised an option to terminate the deal.", "For months, ministers and defence officials had been expressing deep frustration over the deal's progress and a reported $40 billion blowout in the price of the submarines.", "However, the French government said it had received assurance just days before the deal was scrapped that the contract was to continue.", "More to come."]
